item.title: Activejob and Sidekiq
item.description: Rails has a good framework to work with various queueing backends - Activejob Here, I will try to explain how Activejob queues jobs to redis using sidekiq and does not need to know any redis config on it’s own. You can tell the framework that you are using sidekiq as shown below: class Application < Rails::Application # ... config.active_job.queue_adapter = :sidekiq end In my setup containing Sidekiq and Redis with my rails app, I had a custom url for redis.
